main.name: Justin Chow
main.description: I was studying to become a pharmacist before discovering a passion for understanding how people interact, use and navigate the technologies we use everyday. Since then, I've been on the long path towards starting a career in tech. Along the way, I've built an appreciation for user experience, programming, and today's ever-growing world of technology. My goal is to not only grow my skills as a developer, but also as a reliable professional.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Coursework: Intro to Computer Programming (Java) Research Participant | Dean's List 2019

work.title: Project Management Intern
work.description: Collaborated with 40+ interns and successfully increased student enrollment for UW's Early Fall Start (EFS) program. Spoke to incoming freshmen students 1:1 to answer questions about EFS expectations, experiences, and student life. Promoted to team coordinator, communicated with team for check-ins, pain points, and progress reports. Regularly contacted supervisor regarding team and outreach statistics, concerns, and suggestions for improving freshmen outreach experiences.

work.title: Pharmacy Technician
work.description: Dispensed prescriptions in a patient-facing environment. Helped resolve patient questions about insurance, medication ordering, and pharmacy policies. Resolved escalating/difficult patient situations according to pharmacy standards and prevented disruptions to service.

projects.title: BlutoBot
projects.category: A web-scraping Discord bot for fetching stock prices.

projects.title: Pep-talker
projects.category: Text-to-speech web application backed by RESTful API and IBM Cloud.

projects.title: System Design Rework
